channel.title: Plan your build on DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Recent content in Plan your build on DevDocs Navigation Menu Test

item.title: Plan your web application build
item.description: Plan your web application build Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: + This article presents a full overview of all the steps needed to build a web app and configure a web app integration It is interspersed with notes on what to include or not for OIN submission. It refers to SSO but never explains what specifically makes it support SSO.

item.title: Plan your lifecycle manegement application build
item.description: Plan your lifecycle management application build Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Changes to be made: For best effect, it makes sense to rework these articles to match “Plan your web application build” - i.e., to have a How-To \ Guide Hub style article that runs through the entire process of building a lifecycle-aware app. “Prepare your SCIM API service” Article has two distinct sections: “Preparation”, and “Test it works as a private App” “Connect Your SCIM API service to Okta” covers creating a SCIM app integration in the Admin Console “Test Your Okta SCIM integration” covers another set of tests for your app once it is set up as an Okta integration and links to another set of tests to run before submission process is complete Links to original docs: + https://developer.

item.title: Plan your service application build
item.description: Plan your service application build Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Changes to be made: For best effect, it makes sense to rework these articles to match “Plan your web application build - i.e., to have a How-To \ Guide Hub style article that runs through the entire process of building a lifecycle-aware app. Links to original docs: + https://developer.
